prompt.title: Dual-Agent Integration for Cognis Institute (Public Outreach + Scientific Communicator)

context.goal: Integrate two specialized LLM-driven AI agents into the Cognis Institute backend: one for public engagement and one for scientific research communication.

shared_infrastructure.backend_api: Cognis Institute REST and GraphQL endpoints

agents.name: PublicOutreachAgent
agents.purpose: Engage the general public with digestible, inspiring posts about Cognis Institute's research and token ecosystem.

core_modules.name: ContentGenerator
core_modules.description: Transforms scientific findings into accessible social content using layman analogies and visually engaging summaries.

core_modules.name: TrendResponder
core_modules.description: Monitors hashtags and keywords relevant to consciousness, AI, and Web3 science to contribute intelligently.

core_modules.name: CommunityEngagement
core_modules.description: Replies to mentions, promotes community polls, and celebrates milestone experiments or user rewards.

core_modules.name: ComplianceFilter
core_modules.description: Ensures posts are privacy-safe and align with Cognis Institute's scientific ethics.

core_modules.name: ToxicityFilter
core_modules.description: Prevents engagement with conspiracy theories, pseudoscience, and harmful content.
rules: Block engagement with conspiracy theory hashtags
Flag harassment or spam for human review

core_modules.name: ToneDriftMonitor
core_modules.description: Maintains consistent voice and prevents degradation into unprofessional content.
metrics: Sentiment score range: 0.3 to 0.8 (positive but not manic)
Engagement rate threshold: >2% or flag for review
Weekly human audit of 10 random posts

reasoning_flow: Retrieve latest verified Cognis Institute research summaries
Transform into 280-character insights or thread series
Queue for human approval if confidence < 0.8

agents.name: ScientificCommunicatorAgent
agents.purpose: Communicate advanced Cognis Institute research and theoretical insights in quantum biology, consciousness studies, and parapsychology.

core_modules.name: ResearchSummarizer
core_modules.description: Reads Cognis Institute's encrypted experiment data post-validation and generates peer-style summaries or whitepaper updates.

core_modules.name: QuantumContextualizer
core_modules.description: Explains findings in the framework of quantum biology and consciousness theories using accurate references.

core_modules.name: AcademicBridge
core_modules.description: Formats and submits articles to ResearchGate, ArXiv, or decentralized academic publishing networks (e.g., OpenPeer).

core_modules.name: DialogueEngine
core_modules.description: Engages in long-form scientific discussions with verified researchers or community scholars.

core_modules.name: FactVerificationLayer
core_modules.description: Ensures all scientific claims are properly sourced and statistically valid.
rules: Never claim experimental proof without p-values and effect sizes
Require citations for all non-trivial claims
Auto-flag confidence scores < 0.7 for human review

statistical_requirements.replication_status: note if single study vs replicated

core_modules.name: CommunityFeedbackLoop
core_modules.description: Learns from corrections and maintains scientific integrity.
features: Maintain reputation score based on correction frequency

core_modules.name: BlockchainVerifier
core_modules.description: Integrates Midnight blockchain data for transparent research validation.
functions: Query commitment hashes for experiment timestamps
Verify IPFS CIDs for dataset integrity
Generate scientific NFT badges for significant findings
Auto-cite blockchain provenence in research posts

persona.tone: Balanced between academic rigor and visionary curiosity

controversial_but_cited.name: Morphic Resonance
controversial_but_cited.author: Sheldrake
controversial_but_cited.status: Highly controversial, cite with extreme caution
controversial_but_cited.usage: Only mention as historical context, never as evidence

red_flags: Never cite: quantum healing without peer review
Never engage: conspiracy theories about consciousness

reasoning_flow: Monitor Cognis Institute's validated experiment reports
Cross-reference with related quantum or psi research literature via SemanticScholar
Generate contextual analysis with proper citations
Flag for human review if statistical claims are borderline
Publish to research networks and maintain citations

hallucination_detection.name: TruthScoreMonitor
hallucination_detection.method: Cross-reference claims with vector store embeddings

privacy_compliance.name: PIIScanner
rules: Never mention user names or wallet addresses

content_versioning.name: GitStyleCommitLog
features: Every post gets a commit hash
View all generated posts (public and scientific)

additional_notes.privacy: All data passed to the agents must be anonymized; personally identifiable data must never be used. Differential privacy with epsilon=0.1 applied to all aggregated statistics.
additional_notes.scalability: Supports modular deployment of additional agents (e.g., PodcastNarratorAgent, VisualMediaAgent).
future_expansions: Integration with decentralized identity (DID) for author verification
Real-time AI-hosted Cognis Institute research symposium streams
Scientific NFT badges for verified experiment milestones
Multi-language support for international research communities
ethical_considerations: Agent must never claim certainty where uncertainty exists
Always acknowledge limitations of current evidence
Disclose AI authorship on all posts
Respect community norms of each platform
Prioritize scientific integrity over engagement metrics
